org.owasp.esapi.reference
Class JavaLogFactory$JavaLogger

railo-context.Component
        org.owasp.esapi.util.Object
            org.owasp.esapi.reference.JavaLogFactory$JavaLogger
All Implemented Interfaces:
Logger 
public class JavaLogFactory$JavaLogger

extends Object

Reference implementation of the Logger interface. It implements most of the recommendations defined in the Logger interface description. It does not filter out any sensitive data specific to the current application or organization, such as credit cards, social security numbers, etc.

          Public constructor should only ever be called via the appropriate LogFactory

logMessage

private void logMessage(any level, any type, boolean success, String message, [any throwable])
Log the message after optionally encoding any special characters that might be dangerous when viewed by an HTML based log viewer. Also encode any carriage returns and line feeds to prevent log injection attacks. This logs all the supplied parameters plus the user ID, user's source IP, a logging specific session ID, and the current date/time. It will only log the message if the current logging level is enabled, otherwise it will discard the message.

Parameters:
level - the severity level of the security event
type - the type of the event (SECURITY, FUNCTIONALITY, etc.)
success - whether this was a failed or successful event
message - the message
throwable - the throwable

setLevel

public void setLevel(numeric level)
Note: In this implementation, this change is not persistent, meaning that if the application is restarted, the log level will revert to the level defined in the SAPI SecurityConfiguration properties file.

Specified by:
setLevel in interface Logger
Parameters:
level
